name: ITIL 4 Foundation Practice Exam - Final Set

questions.question: Which component of the service value system directly receives demands and opportunities from the external environment?
In which service value chain activity would you create a roadmap for service improvements?
Which practice is responsible for maintaining relationships with external service providers?
When applying the service level management practice, what document defines the specific targets for service performance?
Which of the following is the PRIMARY function of a service desk?
options: Providing a single point of contact for users

questions.question: What is the main difference between 'change control' and 'release management'?
options: Change control assesses and authorizes changes while release management makes new and changed services available for use
Change control is focused on business changes while release management focuses on IT changes
Change control is a technical practice while release management is a strategic practice
Change control is reactive while release management is proactive

questions.question: What is the CORRECT sequence of activities in the continual improvement model?
options: Assess current state, identify vision, implement plan, review results
Create vision, analyze current state, implement improvements, review results
Identify vision, understand current state, determine improvements needed, take action, sustain improvement
Define problem, identify current state, create solution, implement plan, verify results

questions.question: Which is NOT a benefit of applying the 'keep it simple and practical' guiding principle?
options: Comprehensive documentation of all possible scenarios

questions.question: What is the main concern of the 'Organizations and people' dimension?
Which is an example of 'utility' for an email service?
options: The service is available 99.9% of the time
Users can send and receive messages
The service has backup systems in place

questions.question: What is the relationship between 'outputs' and 'outcomes' in service management?
options: Outputs are tangible results, while outcomes are the effects of the outputs that enable value creation
Outputs are always valuable, while outcomes may have negative impacts
Outputs are user-focused, while outcomes are provider-focused
Outputs happen after outcomes have been achieved

questions.question: What is the main purpose of problem management?
options: To restore normal service operation as quickly as possible
To prevent problems and resulting incidents from happening
To manage changes to the IT infrastructure

questions.question: Which ITIL practice is responsible for ensuring an organization complies with regulatory requirements?
In which service value chain activity would you perform user acceptance testing?
How do 'practices' fit into the ITIL service value system?
options: They provide direction and oversight at all levels of the organization
They represent the activities the organization undertakes to facilitate value creation
They are sets of organizational resources designed for performing specific work
They are the entry points where demands for services are received

questions.question: What is a key difference between incident management and service request management?
options: Incident management is unplanned work, while service request management is planned work
Incident management is reactive, while service request management is never reactive
Incident management deals with problems, while service request management deals with changes
Incident management is for external customers, while service request management is for internal users

questions.question: Which guiding principle emphasizes delivering smaller changes more frequently to provide faster value?
Which external factor affects all four dimensions of service management?
What is the relationship between the service desk and other ITIL practices?
options: The service desk operates independently from other practices
The service desk coordinates with incident management only
The service desk is a central point of contact for users and works with many other practices
The service desk only handles service requests, not incidents

questions.question: Which is a key activity in the service configuration management practice?
